title: Running League on a Chromebook
body:
Hello, I have been playing league for quite some time, but recently moved and had to leave my pc behind.  I did get a new laptop that runs on chrome, but was having trouble installing league on it.  I know you have to run crouton and linux and stuff like that, but I never seem to get the steps right, no matter what guide I read.  I was wondering if there was anyone else out there who plays League on a Chromebook, and if they could point me to a guide or video that helped them out.  A video tutorial of someone actually doing it would be fantastic.  Thank you!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

replies.body: Chromebook is not a supported OS, and I'd be really surprised if you can get it working.  While they're great for apps and web surfing, I don't know of any really made for gaming.   Though I can't really offer advise on this, I do suggest our [recommended specs guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements) to help find options.
Thank you for your reply.  Also, I was curious if Chrome would ever become a supported OS in the future.
I'm not part of the team to decide that.  :/  Anything is possible, but it would require meeting the recommended specs.
Well thank you for taking your time to answer me anyways.  I did eventually get it working so i'm happy just for that.
